The Cort estimator

Source: R/Cort.R, R/empiricalCopula.R
Cort-Class.Rd

Cort class

Cort(
  x,
  p_value_for_dim_red = 0.75,
  min_node_size = 1,
  pseudo_data = FALSE,
  number_max_dim = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

# S4 method for Cort
dim(x)

# S4 method for empiricalCopula
dim(x)

Arguments

x

The data, must be provided as a matrix with each row as an observation.
p_value_for_dim_red

a p_value for the localised dimension reduction test
min_node_size

The minimum number of observation avaliable in a leaf to initialise a split.
pseudo_data

set to True if you are already providing data on the copula space.
number_max_dim

The maximum number of dimension a split occurs in. Defaults to be all of the dimensions.
verbose

set to TRUE for more detailed output during the fit.

Value

a Cort object that can be fitted easily to produce a copula estimate.

Details

This class implements the CORT algorithm to a fit a multivariate copula using piece constant density.

Functions

  • dim,Cort-method: dimension of the copula

  • dim,empiricalCopula-method: dimension of the copula

Examples

library(cort)
(Cort(LifeCycleSavings[,1:3]))
